metadata.title: CVE-2020-27560 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
ImageMagick 7.0.10-34 allows Division by Zero in OptimizeLayerFrames inMagickCore/layer.c, which may cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27560` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16').
